website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a toddler-friendly option, this adorable thermos and spork set offers good performance, but it might not last as long as our other picks.
pros: Comes with a built-in utensil holder and complimentary spork for mealtime convenience
Keeps food warm for up to 7 hours and cold for 5
Matching items like juice bottles, cups, utensils, and bibs can be bought separately to make a set
cons: Some owners found that the print flakes off even with hand-washing

customer_reviews.title: Love this cup and so does my toddler
customer_reviews.text: I’m a big fan of skip hop and I especially love the unicorn design I just love it! This cup is great at allowing my toddler to eat her cereal and at the same time practice her fine motor skills. I also like that it has a lid so left over cereal doesn’t get soggy or spill in the bag. So far it seems to be resistant and good quality but I will update once she’s used it for a little while. Hope this helps! If it does give me a helpful vote :)
customer_reviews.author: Giselle Caceres

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why or how, but twice when we put warmed soup in this and sent it to preschool with our toddler, the pressure built-up so that it exploded when opened and the contents by that point smelled rancid, like vomit. I don't know why, the food is warm but not boiling when I pack it in the morning, but we've since thrown it out. Additionally, the lid is very difficult to get on properly so leaking happened frequently (although at least then the pressure wouldn't build up as much) and the design on the side was already rubbing away. Overall, not at all impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Will be returning
customer_reviews.text: This happened the first time I washed it. Looks like water got inside or something?
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product.
customer_reviews.text: The lid doesn't come off, making cleaning difficult. Additionally, it's says top rack dishwasher safe, yet one of the petals that holds the snack in warped in the first time in the dishwasher. Now nothing stays in and this container causes a mess whenever we open it. Not worth getting. Very very disappointed in this product....
customer_reviews.author: Momof2

customer_reviews.title: I've been pleased with this thermos
customer_reviews.text: I've been pleased with this thermos, which I've owned for 1 year and have used it about once a month. I followed the instructions for warming the container for hot food and find that it does the job for the 4 hours that pass between meal prep and my son's lunch at school. I was disheartened recently, however, when I saw that the bottom of the thermos had cracked. I do not think this is due to user error. The thermos has not been dropped, is always handwashed and air dried, so has not been exposed to harsh conditions. For so little use, I was disappointed that the exterior is starting to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommended for toddlers and infants!
customer_reviews.text: We own 4, just to note how much my toddlers love these cups. The lid screws on instead of pops on, which I love because my kids can't take the top off and dump out the contents. The designs are cute and do not wash off as their straw bottles do. The rubber on the inside that the kid sticks their hand through is soft and does not scrape their hands. The top part of the lid clicks closed so it does a great job in the diaper bag. The handle is easy for my toddlers to hold. All around a recommended purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kait Burke

customer_reviews.title: Cute. So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for about a month now, and it's holding up well. My only wish is that the handle was totally connected so I could attach a strap to it, to prevent my toddlers from tossing it out of the stroller. And other snack cups we have like this are made of a more flexible plastic with silicone edges and bottom, to prevent them from cracking when dropped, but this one is just hard plastic, so I do worry about it's durability. But my twins love the puppy face and enjoy lifting and closing the lid. And I also worry that the hinge will break one of these times they drop it, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: TwinMama

customer_reviews.title: Cute, convenient, but difficult to open at first.
customer_reviews.text: I had the hardest time initially unscrewing the top from this. I don't have the greatest hand strength but I can usually get a pickle jar open, so I don't really know why it was so difficult. So far, we like this cup, my daughter seems to like the design but still hasn't figured out how to get things out herself but she's only 9 months old. I like that it keeps things from going stale. It's only been through one washing, I'm afraid to use the dishwasher on it so I've only handwashed it.
customer_reviews.author: Kaycee Stone

customer_reviews.title: Great snack cup!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect little snack cup! My daughter is 18 months and she fussed at first and was scared to stick her hands in the but, after a day or 2 of just showing her she was fine. I was worried because some people complained about the "flaps" being to hard but they were perfect. They do get more flexible with use too. She has dropped their and thrown it on our hardwood floors and it has held up perfectly. UPDATE: Snack but still going strong and I bought another one for her! I got the bumble bee this time and it's so cute! No issues with either of them and yes she still throws them occasionally haha
customer_reviews.author: Jesse's Girl

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not life changing ;)
customer_reviews.text: My toddler adores monkeys and we have a few bits of the skip hop zoo monkey range. I knocked off a star because the lid doesn't actually click closed properly (it seems to, but doesn't), which makes it good for my son but not so good for my handbag which now has goldfish crumbs inside! Also, as some other reviewers have said, it is a little tricky for him to get snacks out. But on the whole this is great - great handle, cute design, colourful for inside your bag (so easy to find) and less messy than a plain container.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not easy for toddlers to use
customer_reviews.text: I gave this three stars because there are pros & cons to it Pros: Keeps food fresh (Serious pro) Doesn't spill out Super cute design that kids love Cons: Very difficult to screw the lid on Kids cannot use this like the munchkin ones. They can't fit their hand in if it is half full or full. So you can't really use the entire bowl for food. You have to hold aside the rubber pieces in order for them to get any food out. Defeats the purpose of the toddler being able to eat it without your help.
customer_reviews.author: GabyStaas

customer_reviews.title: cute&useful
customer_reviews.text: I like skip hop products. This little container is just perfect for everyday use. Because of stomach problem my daughter had to bring her lunch to school every day. After some hours her lunch was warm enough to eat so she didn't have to warm up (and make a mess to use a bowl...). I'm not a big fun of plastic spoon so I bought matching skip hop utensils. So cute as a set and works the same way. We use plastic utensil only for ice cream. After lots of uses it still looks nice but I don't put it in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Kukac

customer_reviews.title: The lid is great, no spilling in the bag
customer_reviews.text: It does just as it says, it holds small cereals (Cheerios) very well. Our daughter had a little trouble at first getting her hand out of the container, but as the rubber flaps wore and softened it became much easier. The lid is great, no spilling in the bag. My only complaint is, I wish the handle was a closed loop, I would like to snap or strap this to the outside of our bag or on the stroller rather than having to keep it loose. The open handle makes this impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler snack cup!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Llama one when my daughter started walking and I loved it so much I had to buy another! She has thrown both of them several times on our hardwood floors and there are no cracks, chips or broken parts. I have hand washed and washed in the top rack of the dishwasher and have had no issues with either. The "flaps" do start to bend inward after several months of use but they still holds her snacks in just fine. *It's dirty in the pic so don't judge lol*
customer_reviews.author: Jesse's Girl

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Keeps my daughters mac and cheese or canned pasta foods nice and warm that I prepare at 7:30 in the morning. Still nice and toasty warm for her come lunch time! She is able to open it herself and the little spork it comes with is great! She is in Kindergarten!
customer_reviews.author: MommyX8

customer_reviews.title: It’s SO CUTE but...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super cute! The only issue is that my chubby toddler can barely fit her hand through the opening. I wish it was a bit wider for her hands to go through and allow room for her to GRAB snacks from inside. When you grab, you tend to make a fist sometimes which is hard for her to take out. The little flaps don’t help either with this. HOWEVER, she did manage to figure it out and she can do it now just fine. I just wish it was easy for her from the beginning ;) still great buy though!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Padilla

customer_reviews.title: I'm so sad that I had to throw it out after just ...
customer_reviews.text: The black ink started coming off after 1 use. Now it's a big smeared mess and leaves black marks on my daughters hands and clothes. I'm so sad that I had to throw it out after just once use. I even followed the washing directions exactly and hand washed with a gentle soap. So disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: NicPack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect snack cup!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little snack holder! I got this for my 2 year old for our to-go snacks of course. I wanted to try a different cup other then the usual ones you can get at the store. These are very sturdy and have the cute characters on them which the kids love. The lid is easy for him to open and close and has a perfect little handle for them to carry around or use it to hook on something while not using it to hang up. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Stenson

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have two (different design) that I rotate while I wash the other one (in my dishwasher and I never had an issue so far and I have been doing it for a couple months now). My little one loves it and caught on fast! Minimal mess so it's nice! If she tips up the cup upside down and grab her cereal, when she pulls out her hand, it does make a slight mess but that usually happens when she is in her car seat. Compare to what it would be if the cup wasn't designed that way, I am definitely not complaining! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Vermont Mom

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my toddler grandson and he loves it he carried it all over the house today snacking out of it. He loves opening and closing the lid. Funny thing he brought it all over the house that it’s temporarily misplaced we will look more tomorrow. But because he loves it so much and we love the idea that he can snack and not leave a mess I ordered another one as backup so the lama one is on the way!
customer_reviews.author: derl

customer_reviews.title: cute snack container
customer_reviews.text: I like these, because they have a flip top lid to close up the container when not in use. The inside flaps also keep the snacks from spilling out. It is kinda hard to get your hand in there, because the flaps are really stiff, but my son doesn't seem to have a problem. I ordered three different designs, because he likes to eat on the couch, and this prevents him from spilling his snacks all over.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Jolley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed and a huge plus for the adorable design very nice quality packaged very well it was a little hard to open it the first time around to clean it but it's gotten a little easier still kind of struggle but its deff not a reason to dislike the product plus itll make it a little harder for the curious littles to open and make a mess the way the handle curves makes it easy for my baby with little hands to hold comfortably so very content
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Castillo

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. We are using this for preschool
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We are using this for preschool. The first day it didn't really keep her food warm until lunch (4 hours from the time it was prepared). It was tepid, but not what I would consider warm. This morning we tried putting boiling water in the jar until her lunch was prepared, dumping out the hot water and then putting the food in. Someone else suggested this, and I am hoping it works. Nice quality container, vibrant graphic, I love the attached fork and so does our daughter. We have other Skip Hop products (lunch box, back pack, rolling suitcase) for both daughters and have always been very pleased with their quality.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Takes toddler abuse very well
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my toddler for his snacks as he tends to eat a little too fast. It has taken so much abuse over months and I'm surprised it's still in one piece. He loves it, it's easy to use and clean and that's all that matters. Do recommend. Love that it has a lid so snacks stay clean and he loves opening and closing it like a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Nireths

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Cute
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for and is super cute. The flaps were a little stiff and my toddler doesn’t like the flaps, so I took an exacto knife and cut them out. It still is perfect for keeping snacks in the car or in the pool/beach bag or stroller because the lid clicks closed and doesn’t pop open even when thrown about the car.
customer_reviews.author: Sam K.

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and my son loves it. However, I didn’t realize that the handle doesn’t connect fully on both sides which totally defeats the purpose of why I bought this. I was hoping I could strap it to the stroller, but I can’t since the bottom of the handle doesn’t connect to the product. Since it’s round, a strap isn’t going to stay put around it either. Other than that, it’s cute and functional, and I like that it has a lid!
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: No more crumb messes in the diaper bag!
customer_reviews.text: We now have 3 of the skip hop snack cups. The connected lid is genius. No losing the lid, crumbs stay out of my diaper bag. I put them in the dishwasher (top rack of course) and have had zero issues after a year of use. The lid can be a tad tricky to put on - but totally worth the trouble (easier than vacuuming the car or diaper bag out!).
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Cute snack cup but opening hard for toddler to use
customer_reviews.text: Very cute snack cup with thick durable material. However the opening is too hard for my toddleR and she refuses to stick her hand in which defeats the purpose. It makes it hard to spill food though which is great. My other con is that the uneveness of the cup make it so that you can't put to much in it.
customer_reviews.author: SSSantos

customer_reviews.title: Okay. Better options.
customer_reviews.text: Cute and I like that it has a lid, but I've purchased 2 other products with lids that are better. This plastic seems like the kind that will shatter if dropped too many times or the "wrong" way. Also I can't fit my small hand in to help him get snacks out. I bought a gerber product that's awesome (strainer which I haven't used fits inside; lid doubles as a base so that you have a handle and no loose parts - genius simple design) and a munchkin stainless steel one that's also great and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: avkTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Cute and useful
customer_reviews.text: I love this insulated food jar. It keeps the food warm until lunch time. Easy to prep. You just need to add boiling water for 2 mins and cover it then you can dump the water and you can add the food, this way it really keep the food warm. Perfect for soups, pasta, rice dishes and more. I'll find a bigger one next time for the next school year.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: No mess!
customer_reviews.text: This is better then your average snack holder for babies. Most are still messy. This one is better by far then the one I had before. It’s harder for her to make a mess with this one. I guess it’s harder for her to get out but she loves it and easily gets one out instead of a handful out like most of these snacker containers.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: My 1yr old son LOVES this snack holder! Sometimes he just likes carrying it around and play with it. But he does love that he can get his own snacks out of it. It's super cute. And it's easy to clean and I haven't experienced any snacks falling out of it, even when my son bangs it around lol.
customer_reviews.author: Britlee

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: This was a little too good at keeping the snacks in because none of my children could pull any snacks out. It was so difficult to get their hands up with how hard and pointy the plastic pieces inside were. My eldest son kept saying, "It hurts too much." There are better brands where the plastic is softer and more moveable so that snacks stay in but little toddler hands can come out.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Like the product. Picture on product matches with a rubber material bib we bought. Keeps food hot enough for 6-8 hrs we have not used food left for longer than that for our baby. We hand wash it so not as convenient as throwing in dish washer
customer_reviews.author: Prasad

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use for both baby and myself. His hands don't get stuck when he reaches in but the snacks don't spill out either. I usually put yogurt bites in there which are quite small but they stay safely in! 3 months later and it hasn't lost its ability to keep the snacks in, no stretching of the rubber top. It's cute and I like the colour because it's easy to grab and notice if I have it on the run.
customer_reviews.author: Anca - Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for nothing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a recent trip we went on. I hand washed it and packed it away. When I got it out and went to use it, the lid kept popping right off and wouldn’t stay on. My husband looked at it and noticed that it’s warped looking on the side. I’m disappointed that my daughter didn’t get to enjoy using this on our trip, that I wasted my money, and that it’s too much of a hassle to deal with a return!
customer_reviews.author: MeganP

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Awful!
customer_reviews.text: Have have twin toddlers. They are 18 months old and have used other snack cups like this. I purchased these because I love that the lid closes so that their snacks don't go stale (like the toddlers care anyway). The opening to put their hands into is designed in a way that makes it difficult for them to put their hands in. My toddlers are not large by any means and do not possess man hands - they simply could not get their snacks out. It caused chaos while I was trying to make them breakfast as endless screaming ensued whilst trying to get their precious puffs from the container. I will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula V.

customer_reviews.title: Threading sucks
customer_reviews.text: Super cute but the threading on it is a little difficult to get the top on and off. It doesn't sit flat due to the threading but I'm ok with that considering the kids will be carrying it around most of the time. I'm more aggravated at how hard it is to twist off and on making it hard to clean. Really cute tho lol
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Threading sucks
customer_reviews.text: Super cute but the threading on it is a little difficult to get the top on and off. It doesn't sit flat due to the threading but I'm ok with that considering the kids will be carrying it around most of the time. I'm more aggravated at how hard it is to twist off and on making it hard to clean. Really cute tho lol
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Used/ washed once and the design already came out. And by the way, I washed it by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana

customer_reviews.title: Cute but disappointed once received
customer_reviews.text: This is super cute and was recommended to us from a mommy vloger on Youtube. However, once we received the item in its package it looked like this item had been sitting in storage for a long time or was used in some way. The plastic packaging was dusty and once opened, the rubber leafs that cover the food whole were scratched and scuffed. Was a bit disappointed for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Kids will enjoy it.
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this I read previous reviews and decided to go with purchasing it. Overall it captures my kids attention and they like using it and eating cheerios from it. I liked how it had the cap to keep the Cheerios from getting stale. So far none of the coloring has faded from hand washing.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Cup is wobbly.
customer_reviews.text: The cup is an odd shape, deeper on one side than the other. The lid does not go on correctly (with handle over the shorter side), so the box wobbles when put down. I bought a second one with a butterfly on it, and that one closes fine and doesn't wobble, so this one must have been a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: The cutest pattern
customer_reviews.text: We have two kids under 3 years old so we have a few of these particular snack cups around, and love them all - they're easy for my kids to open, easy for them to hold, and it's easy for them to get their hand in for snacks without being loose enough that the snacks spill everywhere. We have one with us pretty much all the time. That said, the llama is THE CUTEST pattern of the bunch. My kids are too young to care that much, but it's my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: nmsa

customer_reviews.title: Rubber is too stiff to get snacks out
customer_reviews.text: This cup is really cute and durable but the rubber pieces are too stiff for my one year old to get her hand through and get snacks out. Even I struggle to get any of her snacks out. We don’t even use it anymore. Skip Hop, we love this cup and want to be able to use it. Please make easier for the kids to get their snacks!!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy H

customer_reviews.title: Great travel snack cup!
customer_reviews.text: I love this snack cup. It is perfect for my 2-year-old son. He can use it without my assistance, it doesn’t spill in my diaper bag, and the snacks a stays fresh.Plus they’re all super cute. I docked one star because the lid is a bit difficult to screw on and sometimes hard to screw off. I never get it on right the first time!
customer_reviews.author: Neil Moore

customer_reviews.title: BEST EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONLY snack container on the go that doesn't result in handfuls spilled at a time. We own three of them and definitely will tell everyone we know to get them. Cheerios are contained until little finger reach in and grab a few. If my daughter tried, she could get multiple out at a time but she has dropped it, thrown it, and tried every which way to dump things and it doesn't work. She can grasp just enough to fit in her mouth before having to reach in for more. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: L. S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for snacks on the go
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 11 month old . Still got to learn how to put her hands inside and grab it but its perfect for storing her snacks on the go. Instead of bring the whole container. Lol. She’ll eventually get the hang of it. Exactly how its pictured. Love the design on it. Very cute. Very easy to clean also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold heat
customer_reviews.text: The item we received doesn’t hold heat as advertised. 4 hours after placing hot food into the container, it was cold. I’m disappointed because I adore the matching lunch set. I’ll purchase a new one locally that I’ve had good experiences with in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Mika

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Snack Cup! Holds up against Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Love these snack cups! The designs are so cute and the cup is sturdy and doesn’t crack with my toddlers ability toss things long distances :). The plastic triangles inside the cup help to keep the food from falling everywhere. They are a little stiff at first use but lighten up once the cup is used and washed a few times. We tops it right into the dishwasher to clean it and have had no problems. Great design and would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Really good product. Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Super convenient. I like that this has a lid because most snack still have crumbs okay hahah. My 1 year old can easily get a couple out without everything spilling. She can throw it on the floor without anything happening to it. Maybe a scratch but no cracks and not broken at all. Thumbs up from us
customer_reviews.author: Reyna

customer_reviews.title: Spot on design with a spotty lid
customer_reviews.text: I've been on the search for a cute and practical snack container for my son. I went with this one primarily because I could throw it in my bag and not have to worry about cheerio pieces getting all over the place. The container is also large enough to hold a decent amount of snacks for my son to nibble on through out the day. The reason I gave this container three stars is because the container lid broke off within the first week we got it. My son dropped it on our hardwood floor and the plastic piece holding the lid in place chipped off.
customer_reviews.author: Handrusie

customer_reviews.title: Cute but wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Got the bee snack cup too and paid more than double for the dog because I couldn't find it anywhere else and when I received it and opened it I noticed that the lid wouldn't stay closed..as for the item itself the part that the kids are supposed to reach through to get their snacks out is quite small and not very flexible. My boy gets frustrated because he can't get anything out (he has other brands that he can use just fine). Cute but wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: This product is good, but not great
customer_reviews.text: This product is good, but not great. It's not dishwasher friendly which is a must for us as a busy family of 5. Additionally my kids have a hard time sometimes opening and closing the top lid and the design could have been a little more kid-friendly considering the target market. They are cute and functional and suit most of our needs, just not a 5-star.
customer_reviews.author: MamaD

customer_reviews.title: Cute Product
customer_reviews.text: I love the Skip Hop brands. I love buying the Dino ones for my son. I would say I prefer the Munchkin snack cup over this. Only because the hand catcher is a lot smoother on the Munchkin. Also, depending on how you twist the top back on, it makes it hard to grab the handles; at least for adults.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great for little ones.
customer_reviews.text: My little one loves this. Easy to carry around and reach in for fav snacks. I love that it is durable and I don't find Cheerios all over the house. Super easy to clean and refill. The bee is a cute design as well. My little one has no issues opening and closing the lid. Had to show them a few time at first how to do it now we have no issues. I highly recommend to anyone with little ones that like to walk around with their snacks or even for those who like a snack on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the lid and design is cute!
customer_reviews.text: My almost 1 year old loves this snack cup! Her baby Goldfish and puff cereal fit perfectly. If I could say anything to be improved, the one way membrane could have a little bigger of an opening because she has a little bit of a hard time getting her hand out sometimes, but not enough for it to be a problem. The owl is super cute too! And the lid is a great design so it keeps her snacks fresh and the opening clean.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Good cup
customer_reviews.text: Love this snack cup! My daughter just turn 1 and I wanted to get her a snack cup for her Cheerios. I ordered a different one first that was silicone but the flaps were too flimsy and everything always came out. This one has everything stay put. I only gave 3 stars because it seems like she has a little bit of a hard time to get her hands in it but it’s okay. It stop her from doing a whole fist full grab of snacks lol. Worth the money y’all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best snack cup!
customer_reviews.text: Best snack cup out there! The flaps that keep the snacks inside are soft enough that they don't hurt him. I mention this because we purchased the oxo tot snack cup and that left his hands red! I bought the oxo tot one because it came with a lid, this one is even better because the lid is attached! *Helpful tip*. If you get the monkey version, the ears make it so that your toddler can more easily open the lid. The owl was a bit hard for my 20 month old to get open, but he had no problem with the monkey :)
customer_reviews.author: The Keith's

customer_reviews.title: Favorite travel snack cup
customer_reviews.text: We have several different snack cups, but this is our new go-to for traveling. It’s much more secure than other cups - top screws on and the lid closes. This helps with spills and keeping food fresh. It is a little harder for my 14 month old to get the food out, but I consider it a plus since it slows her down and keeps her busier longer!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Too round
customer_reviews.text: Cute idea, works well BUT it’s almost too perfectly round. It rolls all over! If my kid drops it it starts rolling across the floor making whatever was inside become crumbs. You’d think the handle would stop it but just rolls differently. Hard to explain I guess. I don’t regret buying it. I like that I has a lid, and maybe if you have carpet In your house, this will be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Erica S.

customer_reviews.title: Super cute!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because my niece has the same item and I thought that it is super cute. The snack cup arrived on time and brand new in original packaging. I will probably use a different snack cup when traveling or when out and about.. and will use this one more for when we are home or situated in one place.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Best snack cup
customer_reviews.text: I fill this up so my little mover can snack without a mess. I have an independent little one who really likes to go go go and feed themselves and this mom doesn’t want to constantly be cleaning up a mess. This works great when we are out and about or at restaurants to help keep my little one well behaved.
customer_reviews.author: Harms

customer_reviews.title: Good for on-the-go
customer_reviews.text: I like that it does not pop open if it hits the floor (most of the time). I don’t like that the crumbs of all the puffs get caught under the lid on the rim where it screws on and off so it’s hard to get it on and off. Overall we still use it every day! My 9 month old has figured out how to get his own treats out already!
customer_reviews.author: ALEXXAJE

customer_reviews.title: Pretty design
customer_reviews.text: Just fill up as much you would use it in one time. Do not fill and keep as the moisture will destroy eatables. It is not air tight. Design is beautiful and holding is easy. My Baby, 15 mon needs help to take out snack.
customer_reviews.author: ND😎

customer_reviews.title: Love this little bee snack holder
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my granddaughter. She carries it with her everywhere. Cheerios stay inside and the lid stays put but still easy for a 14 month old to open and close. It's just the right size and comes apart for cleaning. She lost the first one somewhere and I got her another one right away. Better than others that we tried.
customer_reviews.author: vsr

customer_reviews.title: Cute characters deliver snacks in a fun inviting way
customer_reviews.text: These snack cups are cute but also serve their purpose of letting a toddler hold their snacks without spilling. The handle is sturdy yet comfortable enough for a toddler's grip. The cup itself is well-sized with an internal cover that keeps the food in while little hands can get to their snacks. The outer lid snaps in place to keep the food fresh & prevent accidental spills on the go & the best part is the lid is in the shape of fun animals, insects, or amphibians. We got the Owl character but they all are just as cute.
customer_reviews.author: Mythicsagefire

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: We have had 3 of these snack cups. The design and functionality is usually great. However, this one is threaded backwards such that when the lid is on it can never sit flat on a surface. Of course I ordered it as a Christmas gift and the return window closed a few days before I discovered the defect. Pictured sitting next to a red monkey cup for comparison. Monkey is correct. Purple narwhal is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie P.

customer_reviews.title: It’s just okay
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute cup but my two year old has a hard time holding it and trying to get into it. The plastic is cheaper it will crack easily. The lid doesn’t stay open the. When you want the kids to shut it’s not the greatest.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Adorable & functional for your on the go toddler
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know about your toddler but ours is always on the go. These skip hop snack cups are awesome. They have a handle for little hands to hold onto and the rubber material that toddlers stick their hands through is softer than other snack cups I’ve seen. Best of all, this cup has a snap lid. You can close it and toss it in your bag and go. Yet another awesome product from skip hop. Loved it so much that I bought a second one !!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product, like the lid
customer_reviews.text: I like that there is a lid. I have been using the ones that don't have lids, and I have to keep them in a ziploc so the crackers or cheerios inside don't go stale. My 2 yr old has no trouble getting her hand in and out of this. Other reviewers stated it is difficult and may hurt the child, but I haven't had that problem.
customer_reviews.author: raraavisTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Cute Cups- Some Drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: The lid is cute, but does not stay closed. The flaps are stiffer than other cups we have used and makes it difficult for my young toddler to navigate. The result is that he vigorously shakes the cup to extract the contents which results in a dust cloud of crumbled cereal/crackers that is really hard to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: KMG

customer_reviews.title: BEST SNACK CUP
customer_reviews.text: This is the best snack cup I have found! I bought my first one (butterfly) when my almost 4 yr old was about 1.5 and it is still holding up like it’s brand new, she hasn’t ever needed help opening it to get to the snacks she has been able to get into no problem since day 1 and still loves it so I just bought my 1yr old this one for her birthday!
customer_reviews.author: Ashly

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: My biggest issue is that it has only one handle. When buying it I didnt really think having one was a big deal, but my 10 month old daughter seems to have a hard time hold it alone with just one handle, compared to another snack container that has two handles
customer_reviews.author: Lani

customer_reviews.title: Best snack cup!
customer_reviews.text: Ok I’ll be honest- the first reason I bought these was because they were too cute to pass up on. So I bought 2. Once I received them I automatically fell in love with the lid- it’s easy to use and so convenient! The designs are cute and both of my children find them easy to use! These now travel everywhere with us.
customer_reviews.author: MNels

customer_reviews.title: Best snack cups
customer_reviews.text: Ok I’ll be honest- the first reason I bought these was because they were too cute to pass up on. So I bought 2. Once I received them I automatically fell in love with the lid- it’s easy to use and so convenient! The designs are cute and both of my children find them easy to use! These now travel everywhere with us.
customer_reviews.author: MNels

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but monkey coloring is strange
customer_reviews.text: Functionally, it works well, we have other animals and like the design. I really like how it has a lid that closes and the kids can easily open and close on their own. However, the monkeys face is not beige, it's a really awful olive green color. It looks quite odd, and I wish I had selected a different animal.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: Adorable, but not what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: While this product is adorable, I'm a little disappointed. I specifically purchased this one because it has a lid attached. Unfortunately, it doesn't keep my baby's snack fresh. His puffs were stale after 24 hours. We used to have a snack carrier for my daughter that we left full and in her bag ready to go and they'd stay fresh. I guess we will have to do this one only as needed. It is adorable though.
customer_reviews.author: BD1128

customer_reviews.title: Lid helps prevent spills
customer_reviews.text: I used the Munchkin brand for many years with my 3 oldest and would get frustrated because they would shake them around and spill the snacks everywhere. The lid on this Skip Hop snack cup helps with that. It’s also super cute, which is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: S. Clegg

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get snacks
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my one year old, it’s cute but he has trouble getting the snacks from it, and my hands are too big. Maybe when he gets a little older he’ll have an easier time. Bright side is the snacks don’t go flying out!
customer_reviews.author: Karli J. Risk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I love this snack cup. It’s easy for little hands to hold and the handle is so convenient to hook to a shopping cart or stroller so as not to fall off. The lid snaps into place so it doesn’t come open on it’s own but still easy enough for my 2 year old to open.
customer_reviews.author: April Holland

customer_reviews.title: Prep your kids
customer_reviews.text: I know this can get frustrating for some kiddos - but we peaked our toddler's interest and he caught on to this fast. It has made clean up during travelling both in the car and stroller a lot easier! Puffs, Teddy Grahams, Cheerios... They stay in there! It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Rapkoch

customer_reviews.title: It is great for tiny hands.
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect for my 15 months old. However, when my 3 years old is trying to get the snack out of it, it is hard to do for him. His fingers are too long and hands are too big for it. I’d say the product is great and very useful but for very small fingers and hands.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasiia

customer_reviews.title: The best snack cup out there!
customer_reviews.text: Best snack cup I have found. It doesn’t let my 17 month old shake the puffs out everywhere. Also a little difficult to get more than a couple out at a time so helps prevent shoving 27 in her mouth. Also keeps contents fresh longer if you close the lid. Perfect snack cup.
customer_reviews.author: theshug80

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: The mouth isn't wide enough for my son to put his hand in and get the snacks, it also is pretty shallow. The lid closes easily, which caused a screaming toddler every time he would close is but could not open the lid easily so I had to reopen it over and over again. The handle is also so small and hard for toddlers to grab. Munchkin makes a snack holder that is so much nicer. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, clean and fill
customer_reviews.text: Can be a little tough to open when the outside is smeared from greasy toddler hands but I like that my daughter can't easily open it. Dishwasher safe is a huge bonus. Holds a good amount of popcorn, cereal, crackers, nuts, etc for toddlers and it does a good job of keeping my 3 year old from consuming too much too fast. Cute design and handy little handle for toddler hands.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Schiffer

customer_reviews.title: Great cup
customer_reviews.text: So far this is great. It doesn't keep crumbs in but cereal or little pieces work great. My 2yo LOVES it. She loves the design and what is inside it. Lol. It is easy enough for her to use but she can't pop open the lid yet which I think is a good thing as she can't sneak snacks if she finds it in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute and practical
customer_reviews.text: This little snack holder is GREAT! It keeps snacks in, no spills. It's easy for my 18 month old to use, and the design is cute! I bought the alpaca, narwhal, and unicorn cups. Definitely a recommended buy for your littles!
customer_reviews.author: Wheeler985

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my son warm/cool for his school. Really good! It is a life saver because my son just eat puréed food and this maintain the temperature and texture we need.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Won't sit flat
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it is just the cup that I got or all of the dog snack cups, but it doesn't sit on the table correctly. The handle is too long making it unable to sit flat on a table. I had previously purchased the Skip Hop monkey snack cup from a little boutique and loved it! The concept is great, just not sure if the design of the dog cup is off. However...I didn't go through the trouble of returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great thought, not great for tiny fingers
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 20-mo daughter, who loves anything with the skip hop owl. We needed something to put her stroller snacks in and I thought this looked perfect. I think it will be better when she is 2-3 years old, as she can't quite get her little fingers in to pull out snacks. We use the bowl without the top for now, but I wish the plastic fins were removable so that we could just use the bowl with the top.
customer_reviews.author: skidali

customer_reviews.title: Great for your snacker
customer_reviews.text: Love these for our toddlers. We have one for each kid and have given multiple as gifts. Soft plastic on the inside, reduces spills and easy to clean. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the ONLY snack container my little one couldn’t figure out how to take the top off of (and we tried a bunch!). He does sometimes try to pull too much out at once and sling some Cheerios onto the floor in doing so, but a few rogue Cheerios is sooooo much better than him dumping out the entire contents like he did with Boon & other brands!
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: This one is great because if she shakes it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has other ones that, although half the cost, don't have covers. At 20 months old, she shakes them and pops off the top. This one is great because if she shakes it, the cover comes down, and she can't spew cheerios all over our house! It's also held up in the dishwasher on the top rack, and we've been washing it 2x/week for a few months now. I'd buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: C*416

customer_reviews.title: Love the design!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this snack cup. I love that the top screws on so my toddler can't pop the top off. The little rubber pieces keep the food in nicely to control how much my kid is grabbing. Then the flip top keeps the crumbs in while traveling. LOVEEE this cup. I've saw other reviewers have issues with the design scratching or coming off. We have not had that issue yet. We handwash bc it's easy to clean goldfish out with a quick rinse lol but even if it did start to come off I love the design of this cup so much I would overlook or buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Meador

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lil one
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is so easy to clean. I purchased three of these! My little one does really well with its size. He is able to reach his snack without fuss and the handle makes it so easy for him to carry around, or hook to his cup holder in the carseat. Like the different animal options.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy2813

customer_reviews.title: Love the lid
customer_reviews.text: I really love this for my daughter, especially because it could be closed so her snacks don’t get stale. The only thing I found to be somewhat difficult, is that it’s kind of hard to screw the lid on.
customer_reviews.author: Kathrine and Saajen Kumar

customer_reviews.title: It sucks because I bought two of these as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Did product designers actually tested this product? It's cute design however, the rubber of the rid is too thick and hard. It's very uncomfortable to put hand in there. It's sharp! My toddler's little hand kept getting stuck and she hates it. It sucks because I bought two of these as a gift. Wasting money!! So sad I love the design.
customer_reviews.author: sleepytheif

customer_reviews.title: Cute, just right size, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Keeps applesauce and yougerts cool and holds enough snacks, fruit and veggies for him.
customer_reviews.author: Janette G

customer_reviews.title: good size but not very durable on the handle
customer_reviews.text: good size and have been use it fairly often around 2yr age. but not very durable on the handle, we have one that both side of the plastic peeled off. another one halfway through as shown in pic.
customer_reviews.author: Tris P

product_meta.title: Skip Hop Insulated Food Jar: Stainless Steel Baby Food Container, Unicorn
product_meta.description: This colorful stainless steel container keeps kid-sized portions warm or cold. Store the spork, or most utensils, in the handy built-in holder so your little one is ready for meals on-the-go. -Ages 12m+ -Stainless steel body keeps food warm for 7 hours or cold for 5 hours -Built in holder fits most utensils -Includes a spork (spoon+fork!) -Signature zoo characters -BPA-free, Phthalate-free -Holds 325 mL (11 fl oz)
feature_bullets: Insulated food jars keep your baby's snacks warm (7 hours) or cold(5 hours).
Includes a handy built-in utensil holder and spork making the Skip Hop food jar the perfect food container for on-the-go.
Premium stainless steel container features an easy open twist lid that toddler's little hands can open.
Great for snacks at home, preschool, daycare or out running errands

specifications.Care instructions: Hand wash in warm water,soapy water
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars297 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
